website_summaries.verdict: Durable, non-woven fabric blankets designed to protect belongings from dings and scratches during the moving process.
cons: On the thin side, so you may want to double up on valuable items

customer_reviews.title: USED TO DAMPEN SOUND
customer_reviews.text: Do you have issues with sound bouncing through your walls/door from neighbors/roommates/parents and want a relatively cheap solution that can (mostly) dampen the sound? Look no further! These blankets did a decent job for me for such a cheap fix. I was guided here by a Reddit thread and I'm so glad I went with these over the foam wall squares. I didn't do anything fancy with mine I just bought some cheap clips from Dollar General that I could attach them to the wall with and there is a noticeable difference now in sound bouncing in and out of the room. Definitely give it a try if you don't mind the look!
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Amazing value! Buy more than you think you need.
customer_reviews.text: Amazing value! We recently moved using a service where you pack the trailer yourself; the trucking company moves the trailer to your new home and then you unpack it. These blankets were just what we needed! One thing I suggest, is to order more than you think you might need. I thought that we would only need to pack the really nice furniture with these blankets, but now I wish that I had packed all of the furniture and larger appliances (like the W/D) with them too. Several items that were packet into the trailer without the blankets ended up getting scratched. At less than $5 per blanket, better safe than sorry.
customer_reviews.author: Seattle Shopaholic

customer_reviews.title: Some reviews complained about thickness. I moved our home ...
customer_reviews.text: Some reviews complained about thickness. I moved our home by myself, have furniture included. None of these tore. If I was concerned about a piece of furniture, I double wrapped it. These are cheap enough you can do that more cost effective than buying the thick ones.
customer_reviews.author: RamsterTop Contributor: Amazon Echo

customer_reviews.title: Cheap enough to use more than one per item if necessary.
customer_reviews.text: You can't go wrong with these blankets. Many of the blankets I looked at were so expensive. If it's protection of fine furniture you are looking for I would still recommend these. What I did was use stretch film first then taped these blankets around my vintage leather chair. I think it will be fine once I get it on the other side. Many of these blankets are so stiff they hardly bend. I liked these because they are thinner. If necessary it's easy to use more than one because they are so reasonably priced.
customer_reviews.author: Jazzbea

customer_reviews.title: Bought for vocal booth build.
customer_reviews.text: Used for baffling in my vocal booth build. They are probably marvelous for moving and very affordable. For baffling they are somewhat effective in layers. I may order a second set to plaster the outside of the booth with, but I'd guess I have a 10-15 dB drop from inside to outside.
customer_reviews.author: Preston A.

customer_reviews.title: A great moving blanket - perfect size, not too thin, and inexpensive. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased these blankets to protect our furniture for a cross country move and they're great moving blankets. We had previously acquired a smaller and cheaper product and we quickly realized how much they sucked. They were small, thin and pretty much useless. I specifically bought this product because of the thickness, the larger size and the bulk pricing. I was not disappointed. They were exactly what we were looking for and I'd buy them again if we needed more. If you're looking for a great moving blanket that won't make you feel like you got ripped off I'd recommend this product. Don't go with the cheapest and thinnest. You will regret it.
customer_reviews.author: TLWebster

customer_reviews.title: Nice moving blankets and very good value
customer_reviews.text: Had to move lots of furniture from a relative's house. These were very useful. They aren't super thick or sturdy,but the price was right. They'll do the job. A couple had some threads start to unravel after being used several times. Maybe from flapping vigorously in the wind on a trailer for 15 miles. Most didn't do this. I chose the blue ones which are blue on one side and black on the other. I suggest you do too. Folding these up and such the two sides being different color is very handy will folding them to put away, and knowing which side is wrapped around which on furniture.
customer_reviews.author: DeeMee

customer_reviews.title: It protects from A to B
customer_reviews.text: Not what I was expecting. The material is easy to rip if it gets hung on something or you pull at it. Or I should add since packing tape is used for moves, can rip when pulling off the tape. It's filled with fiber pulp, reminds me of blow in insulation. It did the job I wanted so 5 stars. I wish it had a better second life for me, but my cats have claimed them for beds.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel de la Peña

customer_reviews.title: Great Value Saved Our Stuff
customer_reviews.text: Used these for a cross-country move using PODS. They are worth the money. When we got them, we put them outside in the sun for a while and let them air out. They do have a slight smell when you get them. The held up and saved the day a few times once we got to the new house and had to move big furniture around on the new floor. If you’re moving yourself or using a pod storage move, it’s cheaper and you can use them for so much more once you move.
customer_reviews.author: R. Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Just buy them already
customer_reviews.text: These are how they are described, “cheap”. So don’t say they didn’t tell you. However, typo get 12 of them and for me that was more than enough. They will last at least 5 more moves along with the impromptu furniture purchase here and there. They are honestly just what the doctor (mover?) ordered! Pros: - the price, duh - you get 12...? Awesome! - they’ll last until I’m a millionaire and can afford better ones Cons: - they are cheap, but not thaaaat cheap - watch out for the staples when unpacking them, ouch.
customer_reviews.author: Sydney

customer_reviews.title: Moving blankets.
customer_reviews.text: We used these for our move. They fit most of our items well but they did not protect some items well the roughness of the blanket actually ended up scratching up our dresser. I would probably put some plastic wrap between these if you plan to use them and dont want scratches. They did the job other then that but they are really thin and tear easily do not wash.
customer_reviews.author: Renee

customer_reviews.title: CHEAP CHEAP
customer_reviews.text: Read The headline of this item "CHEAP CHEAP". That is exactly what they are. I purchased this item, and when they arrived and I found out that they were nothing but a cheap piece of fabric, I returned them - and then they charged me the return shipping They charged me $17 to return them, and if it cost them $17 to ship, all you have is $20 worth of cheap fabric that you can get at a local craft store and get more fabric than this "CHEAP CHEAP" stuff that loos real nice, but nothing of what it is whatsoever.
customer_reviews.author: The Referee

customer_reviews.title: Excellent deal and great product.
customer_reviews.text: These are not the same blankets used by professional movers but they are absolutely more than adequate for a self move or to use for storage covers. They are large, sturdy and arrived clean and odor free. The seller I used, Cheap Cheap Moving Boxes LLC, got them to me lightening quick and days before expected. They only negative was from the manufacturers use of nylon strapping to wrap the blankets, the metal clasps created a small tear in one of the blankets during shipping, Also, there was one blanket with a dirt or stain mark but they're moving blankets and for the price they're still an excellent buy.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price and for smaller moves
customer_reviews.text: I needed these for moving furniture. They did a great job for the price, on some of the more precious items I used two (added thickness). They protected the furniture from scratches and other damage. The blankets did get holes in them from some of the corners of the furniture. Overall, great buy for a small move or if these are for a quick move. If you move a lot, I would get something thicker.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made, kinda grimy but a good deal for the price
customer_reviews.text: These are about what you would probably expect for this price -- and from a company called Cheap Cheap moving boxes. These are cheap cheap but adequate Chinese made moving blankets. Not a bad deal for the money,despite the the somewhat mediocre quality. Be aware that despite being new, they are very dirty and dusty. They arrive in a single large and amazingly heavy bale.
customer_reviews.author: DaytonaDan

customer_reviews.title: I should have bought more
customer_reviews.text: These protected all our furniture and appliances during a interstate move. They were durable, and just the right size. This is a much cheaper option than getting blankets from U-Haul or other van companies, and much higher quality blankets. I still had to borrow a few blankets because I didn't have enough to pack the truck.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Corcoran

customer_reviews.title: Useful to have around, worked great for my move
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't find a batter deal anywhere else on moving blankets. They came packaged very well and secure. They did have a bit of a smell to them as others have mentioned but it honestly wasn't that big of a deal and the smell quickly went away. These moving blankets are on the thinner side but provided just enough protection for our furniture during our move. As we moved furniture in we also started to use these blankets to protect the wood floors while moving chairs and tables around. Glad i have a bunch of these moving blankets around now, they will come in handy.
customer_reviews.author: Vinny Dags

customer_reviews.title: The product title says it all: "Cheap, Cheap Moving Blankets"
customer_reviews.text: I read the product description, Q&A, as well as reviews and took the gamble. They will work for my needs, but aren't the best blanket available. These are VERY thin as I found during my research; photos of the folded blankets make them look more plush like a more high end product. These are basically two sheets of fabric with a slight amount of filler quilted in between. I'm satisfied with this purchase, but will seek these elsewhere when I need more.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Great value.
customer_reviews.text: I’m not sure why there are so many complaints about these moving blankets. Yes they may have a slight smell to them at first. However if you air them out it goes away. I use these for my dogs because they’ve distroyed any beding I’ve ever gotten them. These are cheep enough that I don’t care what happens to them. And they provide plenty of warmth for them. And yes there spoiled having there own room. 😬
customer_reviews.author: Jeff..

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for what we use them for
customer_reviews.text: We use these in our homeless ministry to give out. They are perfect for that. 1 person can wrap in them and stay warm. These are very cheaply made, so I wouldn't recommend for a moving blanket, but for under a car, to give out, cover plants for frost... things like that... they work. you can'y 4.50 for a 64 sf blanket and expect quality. Come on man :-)
customer_reviews.author: WinU

customer_reviews.title: Not bad, not super thick, no smell.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good. There is a reason it is a best seller. These are not thick, but they will probably protect my furniture from scratching and rubbing on a long move - we just loaded up a giant U-Haul with them. They do not smell at all - people said they stink, mine smell just a little like new clothing - blue jeans. So yes on protection, no on heavy padding, but then are not marketed as having heavy padding. I used two on very important items.
customer_reviews.author: Middle Aged Man

customer_reviews.title: Great value on these blankets
customer_reviews.text: Great value on these blankets. I needed them for a move and while they are quite thin compared to the other blankets I have used they are a great value. I would recommend getting their thicker version even though it costs more as you may end up using two of these with each piece due to the thickness. I could not find a better deal than this online or locally, you won't be let down! They arrive in a huge bag ready to move and come with free shipping!
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: very thin and i'm very disappointed with them
customer_reviews.text: They should have added a couple of more cheap cheap in the name. very thin and i'm very disappointed with them. One already has some holes in it from one little move. I have a cabinet shop and use them for taking cabinets to job site. They covered my white cabinets with a dark powdery stuff. it came off but not exactly what i wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Olson

customer_reviews.title: No padding .... ok, maybe a 1/16” measuring the double side stitch- stay away!
customer_reviews.text: This is not what you might think, or what the description says - there is no 1/4 inch padding, as a matter fact there is less than 1/16” padding, if can be called that. I don’t know why the great reviews, what I’ve got is not what I’ve read in the description - Harbor Freight has the good stuff for about $ 5.00 each on sale most of the time, and I feel like an idiot that I haven’t went there first. Stay away if you want padding!
customer_reviews.author: Teodor

customer_reviews.title: Great Economical Solution to Old Quilts/Blankets
customer_reviews.text: I'm very pleased with these blankets. They arrived, unbelievably securely packaged... Impressive! They're a good, economical solution to protect furniture from scuffs and dirt, instead of using old quilts and blankets. I can only speak to a very short distance move (not done by hired movers). We're not done yet, so will update if they don't hold up with all that's to be moved. Thanks! :)
customer_reviews.author: Lisa W.

customer_reviews.title: Great value and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Perfect covers to protect your furniture and other valuables to ensure that they’re not scratched. These are well-made not as heavy as you might get from one of the professional moving companies but certainly sufficient for just about anything you can think of
customer_reviews.author: Shomare

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, but not thick and probably only good for a few moves.
customer_reviews.text: These are cheap, not particularly thick, and come apart fairly easily. We used tape to wrap some blankets around some pieces of furniture when we moved, and I noticed that removing the tape from the blankets actually tore the fabric. All that said, they definitely helped with our move and were not expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Hip Audio

customer_reviews.title: For sure cheaper than the Home Depot but those are 100x better. you get what you paid for
customer_reviews.text: Somewhere between a 3-4 star here. They are very thin and smell awful if you don't let them air out first. Probably from manufacturing. Anyways, they did what they needed to do. The price definitely reflects the quality. Same ones available at Harbor Freight. For sure cheaper than the Home Depot but those are 100x better. you get what you paid for. I would purchase again. But used thicker, more expensive ones for nicer furniture.
customer_reviews.author: jason p.

customer_reviews.title: Good value for 12, however not exceptional quality
customer_reviews.text: We have used them to move our heavy stuff (table, boxes) and a couple of them have broke through the outer lining and the filling is showing through in areas already. For the purpose of one move, these are working fine, especially the cost for 12 of them, would buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: Sheila F

customer_reviews.title: They do a beautiful job. I just tuck them around the coops ...
customer_reviews.text: I use these on top of my chicken coops as insulation during the winter. They do a beautiful job. I just tuck them around the coops in a double layer when the cold is extreme. The buckets of drinking water for the chickens don't even freeze. The blankets are water resistant and extremely durable. I can just pull them off, drape them over the fence to dry and store them until it gets cold again. Heat lamps are a fire hazard so this is a beautiful solution.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa E

customer_reviews.title: These worked great for our move!
customer_reviews.text: I bought two sets and they did a wonderful job of protecting all of our furniture when we moved a couple of states away. We also hired professional movers to package up the furniture with these blankets, so I'm sure that is part of why they worked so well. I am thrilled that I now have these blankets to use for future moves or to loan out to others who may need them.
customer_reviews.author: sam

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive but effective
customer_reviews.text: These moving sheets are pretty thin and lightweight but then again they are inexpensive. However, they got the job done. I would recommend using two sheets versus one to avoid any major damage while moving. I noticed (post move) that I had minor scrapes/dings on my covered furniture and I only used one sheet. In certain spots on the sheets you can see through the fabric. All and all...they work for the cost.
customer_reviews.author: MoMo

customer_reviews.title: cheaper than renting blankets
customer_reviews.text: Maybe good for three or four moves if you are carful, we bought 4 dozen and probably ripped 5-7 of them but not so badly they could not be used on a second move. Cheaper version of mover blankets but much bigger than the standard U-Haul rentals.
customer_reviews.author: The Goss Family

customer_reviews.title: Not great, but did the job.
customer_reviews.text: Product served their purpose for our move. We needed a lot of blankets and we weren’t looking to spend huge money on them. If you use duct tape to secure them and plan to reuse them don’t try to pull it off. It will rip the whole blanket to shreds. Overall the product serves its purpose and protected our furniture.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Multiple Uses... more than likely
customer_reviews.text: If you have used quilted moving blankets before, these are exactly those. It is nice to have clean, unused moving blankets. The only word of caution I can give is that the fabric is cheap and will rip when you peel moving tape off of it unless you are careful. Everything is moved and unwrapped, and these blankets are decent enough quality to use at least one more time.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Schantz

customer_reviews.title: A Good Lightweight Moving Blanket Option
customer_reviews.text: These blankets are as advertised, rather lightweight. I bought heavy duty blankets at the same time as these and found myself using these lighter weight blankets to wrap chairs while using the heavy duty blankets for items needing more protection. For the price they are excellent.
customer_reviews.author: ProConsumerTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Good All-Around Moving Pads
customer_reviews.text: I don't know about these being "cheap cheap" but they worked well for me. They aren't overly thick or padded, but have enough cushion to keep things well protected during my move. They are quite large, so I didn't have to double up as I originally expected. One pad would pretty much cover the complete top, front and sides of any piece of furniture on which I used them.
customer_reviews.author: Rex

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely worth your money
customer_reviews.text: These were 1000x better than the pieces of felt that Penske provided (and called "moving blankets" - great deal for the money considering that lowes wanted $20 per blanket (of similar quality). I would definitely recommend and I've used them to protect my vehicle (under tarp) for a few hail storm warnings we've had. They protected my furniture nicely. We used saran wrap to keep these in place and it worked perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Antipatiknetz

customer_reviews.title: Get the job done
customer_reviews.text: There isn't much to say other than these do the trick for a move. I bought these to pre-wrap furniture before the movers came. These were affordable, didn't have any strong smell, and held up. They were especially handy after the move to protect our hardwood floors while unpacking, repositioning furniture, and while painting.
customer_reviews.author: Zach

customer_reviews.title: Great Value!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! These are like $19 each at Lowe’s or Home Depot. I wrapped furniture in these to move. Threw them down on the ground to protect wood floors. Used them as padding. They’re great! Especially for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Chloe Girl

customer_reviews.title: Best value
customer_reviews.text: These are truly high quality moving blankets. They come come well packaged, in plastic and a tarp bag to keep them clean. They are big and well worth the money. I looked all over and this was the best deal for this size blanket. I wrapped up several large pieces of furniture in them and they provide great coverage. I feel confident that the pieces I have in storage will remain well protected.
customer_reviews.author: M FN K

customer_reviews.title: Use them in recording
customer_reviews.text: Same as a sound blanket, only a lot cheaper! Put them in layers, where I need extra sound dampening. They really do a great job!
customer_reviews.author: David G. Beneke

customer_reviews.title: Buyer be ware
customer_reviews.text: When I opened the package the first impact was the smell. Like new tires mixed with compost. Gross! Washed them to try and get rid of the smell only minimized it. Also threading unraveled in multiple locations. Filled the dryer with dark lint that was more like silty fibers. Adhered to all the surfaces. Had to clean both the washer and dryer after.
customer_reviews.author: Sylvia Rutter

customer_reviews.title: Great blankets. No "horrible" smell
customer_reviews.text: Great blankets. No "horrible" smell, there's more of a silicone smell (reminds me of our local sporting goods store smell). NOT fluffy blankets, if you want something super padded, this is NOT it. If you want something to wrap furniture in so it doesn't get scratched while moving, these blankets work perfectly. Lightweight enough to fold in half to create "thicker" padding, but fine as they are to wrap furinture without fear of it being destroyed. Ordered around 2 pm, recieved shipment the next morning (no extra shipping paid), talk about impressed!!
customer_reviews.author: ixxBlue_Foox

customer_reviews.title: Smell strong of mildew
customer_reviews.text: These are really thin and smell heavily of mildew/mold. Don't buy! Go to home depot instead. Seriously, these make the whole garage smell.
customer_reviews.author: Lim

customer_reviews.title: Go elsewhere if you are looking to protect your stuff
customer_reviews.text: Clearly not a 1/4” thick, some cake with holes already worn in them from shipping. Not effective for good sound dampening and lack any sort of padding. Edit: product tears incredibly easily, even under its own weight. But it is good for blacking out a window.
customer_reviews.author: Bradley J Webb

customer_reviews.title: If you don't need this many, I bet your local animal shelter could use the extras
customer_reviews.text: Donate to your local animal shelter. I didn't actually handle these blankets, but the shelter was very grateful and said they were perfect.
customer_reviews.author: XOXOXO

customer_reviews.title: Love these moving blankets
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I loved these moving blankets. We bought them awhile ago, and we didn't have a chance to use until last weekend. What a great surprise we had when we opened it. They are so well made, and it really worth the investment. Great product for sure.
customer_reviews.author: AZ Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect! Just what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.text: These blankets arrived right on time and were exactly what I was looking for. Some of the reviews said they were to thin, but these will protect our furniture just fine. I was looking for a big bulky blanket because they will need to be stored when not in use. I will be buying more in the future!
customer_reviews.author: H Smith

customer_reviews.title: These will do exactly what I need at a good price.
customer_reviews.text: These are a decent thickness for moving without spending so much more for thicker moving blankets. I can use two of them if I need more "thickness" as I wrap my items for moving and still save money.
customer_reviews.author: JH

customer_reviews.title: Cheap floor protection
customer_reviews.text: So I tried these as opposed to the ones I can get at Harbor Freight for 5 to 6 bucks each (with coupon), while these are cheaper, they are a bit thinner as well. But no need to schlep over to HF, have a coupon (normally 8 bucks each) and deal with that. And when it comes time to clean up, I don't mind throwing them out at less than 5 bucks each!
customer_reviews.author: AHCII

customer_reviews.title: Worked for my needs but not heavy duty.
customer_reviews.text: These worked for our move but I don't think they would hold up to multiple uses. If you are just a homeowner wanting to use for a single move or light use around the home these will do the trick. I would not recommend for long term or heavy use.
customer_reviews.author: Alan B

customer_reviews.title: Little protection.
customer_reviews.text: Cheap - both in price and construction. These are inconsistently made. They don't offer much padding at all. In fact, there are places that are so thin you can see through them when you hold it up to the light. They are fine for avoiding surface scratches, but don't offer any more protection than throwing a bed sheet over your furniture.
customer_reviews.author: RootsDeepInTheSky

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Had stuff in storage for a couple of weeks so renting moving blankets would have been more than purchasing these. They did the job, not quite the same quality of the ones that you would rent, but sufficient for a self move. Only downside is they shed a lot of lint. Not a big deal since cleaning is always part of moving but it was so much that it actually made the hard wood floor a bit slick.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan J Wojcik

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality Moving Blankets
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to buy these, but I’d do it again. These are good solid moving blankets. My only caution, open the package with a scissor instead of a knife, I curb through the first layer of one of my blankets trying to open then packaging. The set that I got didn’t have any massive odor like others complained about.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan A.

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as described
customer_reviews.text: They're cheap and thin but you know what you're getting. These are 35lbs/dozen. If you want something thicker get 50lbs/dozen. These are half the price of the thicker ones so I use a combination of both for moves. For nicer furniture I use the thicker ones but these ones work fine for cheaper pieces of furniture that I don't care as much about.
customer_reviews.author: djfos

customer_reviews.title: These were the best value that I could find
customer_reviews.text: These were the best value that I could find. They are a little thin however my items which were packed in a pod arrived with no problems. Have used these blankets at the park and at the beach as well.
customer_reviews.author: NicoleK.

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive and Effective for Moving
customer_reviews.text: These are inexpensive and do the job for storing or moving furniture. In addition to protection while moving the furniture, we also used them to move some pieces that were difficult to get a good grip on by lying the blanket underneath the item and then using the four corners of the blanket to lift and move the item. That was much easier on the back. There is an odor (probably the dye they use) that will dissipate once they are aired out for awhile. Overall, a very good value considering that moving companies will charge you a rental fee to use their furniture pads and you don't even get to keep them.
customer_reviews.author: SanDiegoSunshine

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what you'd expect from some simple moving blankets. ...
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what you'd expect from some simple moving blankets. They came in a giant wrapped bundle with no cardboard box so be ready to cut open the package and clean up the mess that wrapping made behind, but that's minor.
customer_reviews.author: JMac

customer_reviews.title: Expected qualty not heavily padded
customer_reviews.text: Amazon review 11/6/2018 for the "Cheap Cheap Moving Boxes 72 x 80 Inches Pro Moving Blankets, Pack of 12, Blue/Black (MB104)". The blankets are not heavily padded but adequate for protecting most furniture. Doubling can be useful for more precious items.
customer_reviews.author: Tech Reader

customer_reviews.title: Buy thick bath towels instead of these blankets
customer_reviews.text: I didn't realize how thin these were. I'm not exaggerating when I say I had bath towels that were thicker. If you really want proper protection for your stuff then order the blankets that are 65/lbs per dozen (that's eventually what I did).
customer_reviews.author: KJ

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the money!
customer_reviews.text: Great for what purchased them for! I hung them in my drum studio for sound proofing.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Robertson

customer_reviews.title: Professional Grade
customer_reviews.text: When you got to move large pieces of furniture these blankets are perfect for wrapping your furniture. They are the perfect size for just about every piece of furniture. Additionally, they are strong professional grade moving blankets. They are surprisingly light for how tough they are.
customer_reviews.author: William Jason Sechrist

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed with smelly sheets
customer_reviews.text: Two stars because the sheets smell like gasoline and stinking up my place! The material looks durable and made with a synthetic fabric smiliar to the soft grocery store bags. Since the package weight a lot and I need it in a few days, it's not worth returning. I'm airing out a few sheets and hope the smell dispates before I wrap it around my furniture. Delivery was quick!
customer_reviews.author: User 001

customer_reviews.title: Good sound dampening, sheds a lot
customer_reviews.text: Sound dampening is great on these, however, they shed like crazy. I had fuzz floating around my boothe for a solid month.
customer_reviews.author: Troy

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, but great!!
customer_reviews.text: These moving blankets are fantastic. The silver side is just rubbery enough to hold to furniture without damaging, and the quilted side is just plush enough to compromise between size and protecting furniture. Used these to move a 24' truck of antique furniture 400 miles away and was very happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon G

customer_reviews.title: Great for self moves
customer_reviews.text: You can't beat the price and the material definitely prevents furniture from rubbing together. Highly recommended for a self move. We bought 3 dozen for this move and couldn't be happier
customer_reviews.author: Fishin Bob

customer_reviews.title: Decent Price, Decent Material.
customer_reviews.text: I would say that these are pretty good, they came a little ripped in two of the blankets and since then one ripped rather easily. They are cheap, so I can't complain. You get what you pay for. They're pretty decent for the price. Overall, it's okay. Does the job you need.
customer_reviews.author: J.C.M.

customer_reviews.title: These blankets are huge and offer substantial padding. I ...
customer_reviews.text: These blankets are huge and offer substantial padding. I used them to move from upstate NY to AZ. They did their job. Buying two packages of 12 was way cheaper than leasing half the amount.
customer_reviews.author: TP from AZ

customer_reviews.title: Great moving blanket
customer_reviews.text: We are packing ourselves for moving. I bought one 12-pieces pack initially, It's very good quality and all the people who helps me packing praise these blankets. I have since ordered another 2 packs.
customer_reviews.author: pokeba

customer_reviews.title: Don't let the name fool you...
customer_reviews.text: Don't let the name fool you...they may be inexpensive but they are not cheap. They are every bit as good as the ones I bought from the truck rental at more than twice the price!
customer_reviews.author: LRS

customer_reviews.title: More substantial than anticipated
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to use as dog pads. Was concerned I was purchasing too many. However, product is thicker than imagined and since receiving them. Have found uses for I had never imagined. GREAT to have handy around the house.
customer_reviews.author: Troy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the budget conscious mover. Good enough to get the job done.
customer_reviews.text: These did exactly what I needed them to do: Make one move from Key West to Indiana. They did their job and kept my stuff from getting destroyed. Most of the blankets are still intact. There are a couple with holes in them. These aren't high quality and they won't last more than a few moves but the price makes them ideal for the budget conscious mover. I'd definitely buy them again if I had to.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel A. Withers

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT PURCHASE THESE THIN, CHEAP NON-MOVING BLANKETS
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT PURCHASE THESE - They are not moving blankets. The DO NOT HAVE ANY PADDING. They are falsely described. This retailer should not be allow to sell these under this description.
customer_reviews.author: CodeBlue

customer_reviews.title: Soft, fluffy, blue moving pads... ...
customer_reviews.text: Soft, fluffy, blue moving pads... just exactly as pictured and expected. We'll be using these to cover furniture during a move and if the last batch we bought are any example, we'll have em around for years until we give them away or forget and leave them outside in the rain.
customer_reviews.author: Ellin Beltz

customer_reviews.title: Great quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: They are a bit thinner than expected but more than enough padding for moving pads. Did not have any issues with shedding, color transfer, etc. - kept my furniture from scratching/dinging during my move and are still in good shape!
customer_reviews.author: Gregory M. Bruening

customer_reviews.title: GRETA PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: These are not the thick type pads you rent at U-Haul...... These are economy type ----But they work absolutely great considering the price. Folks you cannot go wrong with this purchase. It is cheaper than renting the thick ones -- and you get to keep them for other projects.
customer_reviews.author: sosvar2

customer_reviews.title: Good Protection
customer_reviews.text: I used these to protect my furniture in the U-Haul truck and use them to protect the furniture in a storage unit. Quality is good, they aren't too thin or thick. Would recommend these to anyone looking for a deal on moving blankets.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Alison M. Osborn

customer_reviews.title: VEY THIN but they'll do the job for SOME of your furniture.
customer_reviews.text: There is absolutely NO PADDING whatsoever between the two quilted layers. However, you can use 2 of them on Grandma antique table and just 1 on the IKEA crap! They washed and dried fine. Lots of lint but no tears.
customer_reviews.author: farmgirl

customer_reviews.title: These are extremely thin and tear easily
customer_reviews.text: I literally pulled off a one foot section of blanket in the middle of one of them by hand when trying to unpack them because they're so thin and flimsy. But, they're cheap, and I'm using them as dog blankets, so meh...
customer_reviews.author: Reaxions

customer_reviews.title: moving
customer_reviews.text: I like the price I paid for the moving blankets and they worked wonderfully for wrapping my important items to protect from damage. I will be keeping these to reuse for my next move.
customer_reviews.author: CYNTHIA

customer_reviews.title: These disintegrate and are cheaply made.
customer_reviews.text: Eh, these are marginal moving blankets, but you get what you pay for. They are pretty thin and start to disintegrate after one use, shedding black stuff everywhere. They are just “OK” would not purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Janelle Heskett

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the money
customer_reviews.text: Good value for the money. Could be a little thicker but, in the short term, these fulfilled the need to wrap up and protect the furniture that was moved and placed in storage. I should have purchased more quantity as i needed more than I purchased & you may need more than you anticipate.
customer_reviews.author: john

customer_reviews.title: Cheap crud
customer_reviews.text: These moving blankets were very thin and fragile like a paper towel They bare survived a single move, many of them tore like wet tissue paper or unraveled! I should have bought the ones that were a dollar more!
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Too thin - was not what I expected as a 'moving blanket'
customer_reviews.text: Cheap is right - perhaps I bought these in haste compared to others on here. I found these to very thin. It would take a couple of them to equal the thickness of the ones I purchased from Harbor Freight. I would look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Freedom Builders

customer_reviews.title: Very thin
customer_reviews.text: There are very thin and I wouldn't even call them moving blankets. I would say these are about half the tickness of a real moving blanket. I took a chance with the positive reviews but read the verified ones. They are all two star like mine.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous2001

customer_reviews.title: Great moving blankets!
customer_reviews.text: I moved accross the country and bought these to protect my furniture inside the PODs I shipped. They worked great and nothing got damaged! Highly recommend!👍
customer_reviews.author: Lotus Cowboy

customer_reviews.title: Not the thickest. But, does a fine job.
customer_reviews.text: We used these for a self move on some upholstered furniture and some laminate furniture. These worked fine. They are likely not really reusable. But, covered and protected our furniture well enough for an in town move.
customer_reviews.author: sewbaby

customer_reviews.title: WORTH THE $60, CHEAPER  RENTING BLANKETS..
customer_reviews.text: Awesome for the money!!! Didnt rip or tear, surprised!! unless you drag them on ground. Cheaper than paying $150 to rent them. I used all twelve, if you move frequently or have expensive items... USE THESE
customer_reviews.author: lafftoomuch

customer_reviews.title: These work great!!!!!  And for price its a no brainer
customer_reviews.text: These feel thick but arent that heavy. The color is nice. I used 4 blankets to cover a 4' by 9' couch that i had to store in my moms garage till i move. And wanted it covered well. This did the job. That was the 4 pack. Since then i bought this 12 pack as i have some big Cerwin Vega speakers i need to cover that are in the garage. These are also nice to just throw one in the trunk of a car to have a "blanket".
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Junkie

customer_reviews.title: Kept furniture safe in a cross-country move.
customer_reviews.text: Great for moving. I also use these as paint blankets and my dog has started using one as a bed. Kept my furniture in good condition while in a POD for 9 months and being transported across country.
customer_reviews.author: Andy H

customer_reviews.title: Great furniture protectors
customer_reviews.text: I had to help my daughter move and this bundle of pads really helped. Came well packaged in a compress wrap. Protected her furniture during the move in my trailer.
customer_reviews.author: Living Up North

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: For "cheap, cheap", they are great, great. I have used the same blankets for 2 moves. Only one has ripped and that was the mover's fault. They fold and stack neatly for the next use. (I used them with moving bands.)
customer_reviews.author: KY Woman

customer_reviews.title: Good for occasional moving usage
customer_reviews.text: I have been moving a bunch of stuff, in multiple trips, so some of the blankets have been used 4 or 5 times. They work well for preventing scuffs, but they are already beginning to show some wear. They are basically fine for most people, who might move from one apartment to another, a few times. However, if you are a professional mover who uses blankets everyday, you will be better off with more rugged blankets.
customer_reviews.author: Tired of Junk

customer_reviews.title: This product is cheap and poor quality. Put it on the light and you ...
customer_reviews.text: The name says it all. This product is cheap and poor quality. Put it on the light and you will see many holes. If it were a bit thinner, it would unravel in your hands.
customer_reviews.author: WF

customer_reviews.title: What is that smell?!?!
customer_reviews.text: I could barely breathe when I opened these, the weird perfume/air freshener smell is so strong!!!! They are currently airing out in the back yard. They are rather thin. Additionally, I saw that the seller advised that they are cotton, and that is completely false. They are a synthetic, non woven material. I imagine they will serve their purpose, but keep your expectations low.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Miller

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny! Wished I had bought 4!!
customer_reviews.text: Product was well made. Did not notice out of the ordinary smell. Bought 3 packages for a large 4 bedroom home, 40 foot truck's worth but needed 4 packages. Would def buy again! Made moving my dining chairs and library shelves a breeze!
customer_reviews.author: Sunshine AZ

customer_reviews.title: No kidding Cheap Cheap is the name of the product.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 2 bundles of these moving blankets and was very disappointed with the quality. They had little to no padding. These blankets Cost about $5 each ($60 for 12) and I ended up purchasing better quality from Harbor Freight for $9 each. Even though they were almost twice as much, they feel much more durable.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: I had these mailed and waiting for me when I got there which was super convenient.
customer_reviews.text: You can definitely buy these cheaper in perrson, but I needed to move a storage unit from across the country. I had these mailed and waiting for me when I got there which was super convenient.
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: These are actually quite nice.
customer_reviews.text: I have no idea what I'll do with three dozen of these once the move is done but they definitely do the job of protecting your furniture.
customer_reviews.author: Lilah

product_meta.title: Moving Blankets - Professional Packing Shipping Moving Pads - Cheap Cheap Moving Boxes (Pro Blankets (35 lb/dz) - 12 Pack)
feature_bullets: QUALITY: Industry standard, 80 x 72 Premium, Professional-Grade moving pads protect valuable items from scratches, nicks and dirt while moving, storing or transporting furniture, appliances, and other large household items.

CUSHION/BATTING: Constructed of pre-consumer cotton batting/filler and a durable polyester binding, these packing blankets offer an economical solution compared to most competitor's blankets made from post-consumer recycled material. Zig-zag stitching holds inner cushioning in place for consistent padding protection and extended use.

DURABLE: Weighing approximately 2-9/10 +/- pounds per pad, these durable furniture blankets feature a reinforced double-lock cotton stitch with a polyester binding that resistant’s tears and built for multiple use.
USE: Ideal economical solution for both professional and the do-it-yourself mover. These general-purpose moving blankets are best used for protecting items in storage or in transit and much more.
PROFESSIONAL TIP: Always use the same side (color) facing up. Dust, dirt and debris can attach to blankets in storage or transit. Using face upside down, can cause scratching to valuable furniture.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars1,023 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
